intro: Canala heliotropioides, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypselae. Canala heliotropioides is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
